context: The Finnish verb 'auttaa' means 'to help'. It is a transitive verb, meaning it takes an object. The basic form of the word is 'auttaa', and it can be conjugated to different tenses and persons as shown in the dictionary definition.  It often takes the illative case of the third infinitive ('to do') or the inessive case ('with (work)'). For example, 'Voin auttaa sinua tekemään sen' translates to 'I can help you do it'. The word is related to 'apu', which means 'help'.
